holidays.name: Rare Disease Day (sometimes observed on Feb 28)
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness for rare diseases and advocate for better research, treatment, and support for individuals affected by them. It highlights the challenges faced by people with conditions affecting very few worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established in 2008 by EURORDIS, a European rare disease alliance, February 28 (or 29 in leap years) was chosen to emphasize rarity ‚Äî just like the date itself!
holidays.funFact: There are over 7,000 known rare diseases, but only a fraction have approved treatments, which is why awareness days like this are vital.

holidays.name: Floral Design Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the art and creativity involved in designing floral arrangements, encouraging people to appreciate, create, and gift beautiful bouquets.
holidays.origin: This day originated from floral industry organizations to promote the profession and inspire people to explore floral design as a form of artistic expression.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known floral arrangement dates back to ancient Egyptian tombs, around 2500 BCE, showing humanity's long love affair with flowers.
